issue.title: no-unneeded-ternary with arrow function results in parsing error

repository.name: standard
repository.description: ðŸŒŸ JavaScript Style Guide, with linter & automatic code fixer

issue.body:
**What version of standard?**
12.0.1
**What operating system, Node.js, and npm version?**
â¬¢ 8.11.2 ðŸ“¦ 5.6.0

Using the `no-unneeded-ternary` rule.
When formatting code that is using a ternary like below, the function is not wrapped, causing a parse error and fails.
```
const foo = true
const bar = foo ? foo : () => {}
```
Causes this error
```
  2:21  error  Parsing error: Unexpected token

  1 | const foo = true
> 2 | const bar = foo || () => {}
    |                     ^
  3 |

âœ– 1 problem (1 error, 0 warnings)
```

*EXPECTED*
```
const bar = foo || (() => {})
```

body:
Thank you for the report.

I could reproduce this on [our online demo](https://eslint.org/demo/#).
Yes, it's a bug to fix.

issue.title: RuleTester should report syntax error of fixed code

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This change enhances an existing feature of ESLint

labels.name: core
labels.description: Relates to ESLint's core APIs and features

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
**The version of ESLint you are using.**

- master

**The problem you want to solve.**

I found `RuleTester` doesn't report any errors even if autofix makes a syntax error in #11579.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1937871/56079186-d7e19280-5e2b-11e9-83b3-f8dc7e46fb10.png)

I expected above test results to be "A fatal parsing error occurred in autofix: Parsing error: ..." rather than "Output is incorrect".

**Your take on the correct solution to problem.**

`RuleTester` makes failing if autofix made a syntax error.

**Are you willing to submit a pull request to implement this change?**

Yes.

issue.title: Fix: autofix of no-unneeded-ternary made syntax error (fixes #11579)

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint

issue.body:
<!--
    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://js.foundation/community/code-of-conduct).
-->

**What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to item)**

[X] Bug fix

**What changes did you make? (Give an overview)**

This PR fixes #11579.
The new logic uses operator precedence instead of whitelist of node types in order to check the necessity of parenthesizing.

**Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?**

Nothing in particular.
